title: Masked image from results doesn't match input
body:
Hi,

I have run this model before successfully before with my own image, using the masks provided by the dataset you used.
I have tried using it again with my own masks, but the results I am getting are like the masked region is way bigger than the one I am actually using, so the edge model doesn't work properly, as there is too much area too inpaint. Doo you have any idea of what I could be doing wrong?

Images:
Input image and mask
![input_image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7942407/80821389-8770da80-8bd0-11ea-8271-a12140412109.png)

![input_mask](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7942407/80821415-935c9c80-8bd0-11ea-80fd-fdd9fd3d8393.png)

Debugging result output, masked, egde, and final inpainted result:
![output_masked](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7942407/80821424-99527d80-8bd0-11ea-8528-606f867469ec.png)

![output_edge](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7942407/80821450-a66f6c80-8bd0-11ea-8da8-4b97d7166412.png)

![output-result](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7942407/80821610-f9e1ba80-8bd0-11ea-8d6a-da0d0e98aabc.png)

config.yml

> MODE: 2             # 1: train, 2: test, 3: eval
MODEL: 3            # 1: edge model, 2: inpaint model, 3: edge-inpaint model, 4: joint model
MASK: 3             # 1: random block, 2: half, 3: external, 4: (external, random block), 5: (external, random block, half)
EDGE: 1             # 1: canny, 2: external
NMS: 1              # 0: no non-max-suppression, 1: applies non-max-suppression on the external edges by multiplying by Canny
SEED: 10            # random seed
GPU: [0]            # list of gpu ids
DEBUG: 1            # turns on debugging mode
VERBOSE: 0          # turns on verbose mode in the output console

running command:
`python test.py --input examples/myimages/images/occ0-test-small-square.png --mask examples/myimages/masks/mask0-test-small-square.png --output checkpoints/myimages-results/occ0_output --checkpoints checkpoints/places2/`
